ygData.subject: RE: Max damage?
ygData.msgSnippet: Uhh, remember the endless thread about a new term for twisting ? Well, it was kicked off by J.M. who plays a bard and is on dev team at Verant.  He said he
ygData.messageBody:
Uhh, remember the endless thread about a new term for "twisting"?

Well, it was kicked off by J.M. who plays a bard and is on dev team at
Verant. He said he hates the term but that the technique is an important
one for bards.

So, rest assured that it is there for those of us to use as we see fit.

Sylly.

-----Original Message-----
From: Schafer, Timothy L 1425
[mailto:Timothy.Schafer@...]
Sent: Monday, July 12, 1999 3:22 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Max damage?

From: "Schafer, Timothy L 1425"
<Timothy.Schafer@...>

[snipped]

I know that most bards do twist, and I do not hold this
against you in any
ways, but are you wanting me to believe that the game was
designed to do
this? I don't believe it was, I think the reasons the songs
don't stop
immediately is so that if you get bashed or stunned, that
you can restart
the song without losing the effect of whichever song you
were playing.

This is just my 2cp.

Wenaddar 17th level bard of Cazic-Thule
